bibl.title: The Political Economy of Romance in Late Period Egypt.
bibl.note: Taking four major texts - the Life of Aḥiqar (Old Aramaic), the Bentresh Stele (Ptolemaic hieroglyphs), Chariton's Callirhoē (Greek), and the Cambyses-Romance (Coptic) - shows that each fiction both reflects and serves to mediate Egypt's changing and increasingly marginalized position within the continuously evolving Levantine-Mediterranean world system. - Avec résumé en anglais.

bibl.title: The Construction of the Real and the Ideal in the Ancient Novel

bibl.seg: Daniel L. Selden, The Political Economy of Romance in Late Period Egypt.
Michael Paschalis & Stelios Panayotakis (edd.), The Construction of the Real and the Ideal in the Ancient Novel = Ancient Narrative. Supplementum 17 (Groningen, 2013) pp. 1-40, 8 figg.; - 293.

Taking four major texts - the Life of Aḥiqar (Old Aramaic), the Bentresh Stele (Ptolemaic hieroglyphs), Chariton's Callirhoē (Greek), and the Cambyses-Romance (Coptic) - shows that each fiction both reflects and serves to mediate Egypt's changing and increasingly marginalized position within the continuously evolving Levantine-Mediterranean world system. - Avec résumé en anglais.
